The 'Weymouth Back River', sometimes called 'Back River', is a short,
primarily tidal river in Hingham and Weymouth, Massachusetts, about south of
Boston. It arises from a number of tributaries in ponds and swamps, most
notably Whitmans Pond, flows northward, and empties into Hingham Bay (just
south of Grape Island and Slate Island). , esker is the
tree-covered ridge on right. ]]
